intro: Thayeria cornucopia, commonly known as the horned bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Thayeria cornucopia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
